page.title: 14FARMING
page.content: MR STURDY, THE WATER BAILIFF FEEDS THE FISH WITH AN AUTOMATIC FEEDER HE PUTS FISH FOOD ON A RUBBER CONVEYER BELT AND SETS THE TIMER. THE FISH ARE FED WHEN REQUIRED IN SMALL QUANTITIES OVER A 12 HOUR PERIOD. AS THE FISH GROW BIGGER HE PUTS THEM INTO DIFFERENT TANKS WHICH ARE LIKE BATH TUBS. HE MAY MOVE 1,000 OR MORE AT A TIME. TO HELP HIM COUNT, EVERY TIME HE REACHES 100, HE PUTS A STONE IN A BUCKET. WHEN THE FISH ARE 10 TO 12 INCHES LONG THEY ARE PUT DOWN A SHUTE INTO THE RIVER. THE RAINBOW TROUT TAKE 15 TO 18 MONTHS BEFORE THEY ARE BIG ENOUGH FOR THE RIVER. THE BROWN TROUT ARE PUT INTO THE RIVER AFTER 27 MONTHS.
